verses.text_plain: They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man’s, shall he return unto her again? shall not that land be greatly polluted? but thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
1They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man’s, shall he return unto her again? shall not that land be greatly polluted? but thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith the Lord. ▼
▼ They say: Heb. Saying

tokens.text: shall he return unto her again
but thou hast played the harlot

footnotes.body_html: ▼ They say: Heb. Saying

verses.text_plain: Lift up thine eyes unto the high places, and see where thou hast not been lien with. In the ways hast thou sat for them, as the Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.
verses.verse_html: 2Lift up thine eyes unto the high places, and see where thou hast not been lien with. In the ways hast thou sat for them, as the Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.

verses.text_plain: Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; and thou hadst a whore’s forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed.
verses.verse_html: 3Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; and thou hadst a whore’s forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed.

tokens.text: and there hath been no latter rain

verses.text_plain: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My father, thou art the guide of my youth?
verses.verse_html: 4Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My father, thou art the guide of my youth?

tokens.text: Wilt thou not from this time cry

verses.text_plain: Will he reserve his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and done evil things as thou couldest.
verses.verse_html: 5Will he reserve his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and done evil things as thou couldest.

verses.text_plain: The Lord said also unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.
verses.verse_html: 6The Lord said also unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.

tokens.text: also unto me in the days
and there hath played the harlot

verses.text_plain: And I said after she had done all these things, Turn thou unto me. But she returned not. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.verse_html: 7And I said after she had done all these things, Turn thou unto me. But she returned not. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.

tokens.text: thou unto me. But she returned

verses.text_plain: And I saw, when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away, and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but went and played the harlot also.
verses.verse_html: 8And I saw, when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away, and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but went and played the harlot also.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that she defiled the land, and committed adultery with stones and with stocks.
verses.verse_html:
9And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that she defiled the land, and committed adultery with stones and with stocks. ▼
▼ lightness: or, fame

tokens.text: And it came to pass through the lightness

verses.text_plain: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not turned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
10And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not turned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith the Lord. ▼
▼ feignedly: Heb. in falsehood

tokens.text: And yet for all this her treacherous
unto me with her whole heart

footnotes.body_html: ▼ feignedly: Heb. in falsehood

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto me, The backsliding Israel hath justified herself more than treacherous Judah.
verses.verse_html: 11And the Lord said unto me, The backsliding Israel hath justified herself more than treacherous Judah.

verses.text_plain: Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the Lord; and I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful, saith the Lord, and I will not keep anger for ever.
verses.verse_html: 12Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the Lord; and I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful, saith the Lord, and I will not keep anger for ever.

tokens.text: I will not cause mine anger

verses.text_plain: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the Lord thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 13Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the Lord thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Turn, O backsliding children, saith the Lord; for I am married unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:
verses.verse_html: 14Turn, O backsliding children, saith the Lord; for I am married unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:

tokens.text: unto you: and I will take

verses.text_plain: And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.verse_html: 15And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass, when ye be multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the Lord, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of the Lord: neither shall it come to mind: neither shall they remember it; neither shall they visit it; neither shall that be done any more.
verses.verse_html:
16And it shall come to pass, when ye be multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the Lord, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of the Lord: neither shall it come to mind: neither shall they remember it; neither shall they visit it; neither shall that be done any more. ▼
▼ come to mind: Heb. come upon the heart
 , ▼
▼ that…: or, it be magnified

tokens.text: And it shall come to pass, when ye be multiplied

footnotes.body_text: ▼ come to mind: Heb. come upon the heart
footnotes.body_html: ▼ come to mind: Heb. come upon the heart
▼ that…: or, it be magnified

verses.text_plain: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the Lord; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the imagination of their evil heart.
verses.verse_html:
17At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the Lord; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the imagination of their evil heart. ▼
▼ imagination: or, stubbornness

verses.text_plain: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers.
verses.verse_html:
18In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers. ▼
▼ with: or, to
 , ▼
▼ given…: or, caused your fathers to possess

tokens.text: that I have given for an inheritance

footnotes.body_text: ▼ given…: or, caused your fathers to possess
footnotes.body_html: ▼ given…: or, caused your fathers to possess

verses.text_plain: But I said, How shall I put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of nations? and I said, Thou shalt call me, My father; and shalt not turn away from me.
verses.verse_html:
19But I said, How shall I put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of nations? and I said, Thou shalt call me, My father; and shalt not turn away from me. ▼
▼ from me: Heb. from after me
 , ▼
▼ a goodly…: Heb. an heritage of glory, or, beauty
 , ▼
▼ pleasant…: Heb. land of desire

footnotes.body_text: ▼ from me: Heb. from after me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ from me: Heb. from after me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a goodly…: Heb. an heritage of glory, or, beauty
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a goodly…: Heb. an heritage of glory, or, beauty
▼ pleasant…: Heb. land of desire

verses.text_plain: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
20Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith the Lord. ▼
▼ husband: Heb. friend

verses.text_plain: A voice was heard upon the high places, weeping and supplications of the children of Israel: for they have perverted their way, and they have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.verse_html: 21A voice was heard upon the high places, weeping and supplications of the children of Israel: for they have perverted their way, and they have forgotten the Lord their God.

verses.text_plain: Return, ye backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we come unto thee; for thou art the Lord our God.
verses.verse_html: 22Return, ye backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we come unto thee; for thou art the Lord our God.

verses.text_plain: Truly in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitude of mountains: truly in the Lord our God is the salvation of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 23Truly in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitude of mountains: truly in the Lord our God is the salvation of Israel.

verses.text_plain: For shame hath devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
verses.verse_html: 24For shame hath devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.

verses.text_plain: We lie down in our shame, and our confusion covereth us: for we have sinned against the Lord our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day, and have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.
verses.verse_html: 25We lie down in our shame, and our confusion covereth us: for we have sinned against the Lord our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day, and have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.
